title: Old Spanish National Historic Trail: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The University of New Mexico helps the National Park Service celebrate their 100th anniversary! Landscape students in the School of Architecture and Planning aid in historic trail work. Read all about it! http://news.unm.edu/news/unm-helps-the-national-park-service-celebrate-their-100th-anniversary       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Old Spanish National Historic Trail is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      The Crookedest Most Arduous Pack Mule Route  Discover Old Spanish National Historic Trail through museums, historic sites, landmarks, and trail routes located all along the length of the trail through New Mexico, Colorado, Utah, Arizona, Nevada, and California. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.        Have fun watching this video: Centennial! by Youth Ambassador Program. It's awesome! www.facebook.com/nationalparkservice/videos/10153082146076389/
